thread.title: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections
thread.title_full: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Freelancer
title: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections
text:
The following are a sampling of food operation inspection reports from Public Health – Dayton & Montgomery County, from the week of Sept. 21-25. View full inspections reports at inspections.phdmc.org.
Penn Station
8927 Kingsridge Drive, Dayton
Date of inspection: Sept. 21
Violations: Observed multiple foods, inside sandwich prep cooler, being held cold above 41F. Ensure foods are held cold at or below 41F in order to limit the growth of bacteria.
- Sliced turkey- CH- 50.0F- PIC voluntarily discarded 1 medium pan.
- Sliced ham- CH- 50.0F- PIC voluntarily discarded 1 medium pan.
- Cut sausage- CH- 56.5F- PIC voluntarily discarded 1 medium pan.
- Sliced corn beef- CH- 52.0F- PIC voluntarily discarded 1 medium pan.
- Raw chicken- CH- 53.0F- PIC voluntarily discarded 1 large pan.
PIC was informed to ensure foods are placed on ice or in another working cooler. PIC was also informed that it is recommended that food temperatures are monitored and recorded multiple times per day. PIC contacted maintenance for repair during inspection.
Observed left door gasket, on display cooler, in disrepair. Ensure cooler gasket is replaced so that it is intact, smooth, and easily cleanable.
Observed multiple spray bottles not labeled. Ensure spray bottles are labeled with name of contents so that possible contamination is prevented. Bottles hanging over three compartment sink.
Comments: Observed handsinks supplied with soap, hot water, and paper towels.
Observed acceptable sanitizer levels in sanitizer buckets (chlorine bleach) and in three compartment sink (quaternary ammonia).
Discussed cleaning of soda nozzles with PIC. Ensure nozzles are cleaned and maintained so that they are free of build-up. Soaking should not substitute wash, rinse, and sanitize.
PIC was informed that all coolers shall be provided a working thermometer and a food probing thermometer shall be available for use at all times.
A re-inspection shall occur 09/25/2015 or thereafter.
Rally’s
5800 Springboro Pike, Dayton
Date of inspection: Sept. 21
Violations: Observed door gaskets in ALL coolers with build-up of food residue. Ensure each door gasket is cleaned more frequently and maintained so that they are free of build-up.
Observed floors and walls, under and behind equipment, with build-up of food residue. Ensure floors and walls are cleaned more frequently and maintained so that they are free of build-up.
- Behind ice cream cooler and shelving
- Around mop sink
Comments: Spoke with PIC concerning missing light shield above single service items (cups and lids). PIC stated she is aware of problem and is scheduled to be replaced next week. Cups and lids are covered with plastic and stored in cardboard.
PIC was informed to ensure foods are held cold at or below 41F, held hot at or above 135F, and re-heated to a minimum of 165.0F.
Observed handsink supplied with soap, hot water, and paper towels.
Observed acceptable sanitizer levels (chlorine bleach) in three compartment sink and in sanitizer buckets.
